title: Fiddles should have a different running animation when he has Dread
body:
Thought it'd be more thematically logical.
http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/6.9.1/img/passive/Fiddlesticks_Passive.png
His passive icon shows him lunging towards his enemy, yet he has a normal running animation when he gets the passive. Adding a sprinting animation would make him creepier and add more visual clarity.

replies.body:
Agreed, that would be awesome. If we eventually get to do a Fiddle VU at some point would love to see us do a bunch of animations like that for him while still preserving the charm and creepiness of his existing animations. 

For the mid-season patch we weren't able to do much in the way of animation work unfortunately, with the team's animators instead focused on Taric, Ryze and Yorick during the same time period.

Fiddle hasn't seen competitive play since season 1.

Fiddle hasn't been a popular pick since. Season. 1.

Fiddle has one of the lowest player bases. The weirdest item path. One of the most binary kits.

Fiddle is broken. Fiddle is a problem.

Fiddle's a niche champion, in terms of playstyle and theme. That's fine, some people will love him a lot, most won't care for him. In a roster of 130+ champions many characters should be niche like that. He's got some unusual playstyle stuff going on, and some build weirdness, which is reflective of his age, but also I'd argue some of his charm. If you want to play a champ a lot of other people play too Fiddle's seldom going to be the right champ for you, unless he's really overpowered. 
 
Last time I can think of Fidd that was in competitive play was Season 4 worlds. There was a time in, I think season 3, possibly 4, where he was a common support pick as well. Suspect he's probably seen some niche play in the last couple of seasons too, not certain though. Regardless, claiming he hasn't seen competitive play since Season 1's pretty far off the mark.

Most of that is true. The thing is, it's easier to shaft an unpopular, weak champion for changes than a popular, strong one. Fiddles has a functioning kit, and that's all Riot is really looking for to leave him behind other, more messed up champions (Yorick, previously Poppy).

You can make AP Garen work. Wtfs your point?

I'm not sure about that one. Pre-juggernaut rework and pre-DFG removal, maybe, but he currently has no AP scaling that I can see. 

That point aside, I understand your point. The thing is, Fiddles can be reliable. An off-meta, opposite scaling build is super unreliable on the most part, since a large majority of them are not intended as the playstyle of the champion and therefore have much more fatal flaws compared to normal builds. The reason why they sometimes work is because the opposing team does not know those flaws. Fiddles doesn't really rely on his opponent not knowing how he works. It can definitely help him, but it isn't his only asset. Fiddles is a lot more like Amumu, succeeding more than usual because people don't play correctly, since they don't understand the champion's capabilities, but a decent champion in his own right.

Champion updates are chosen based off how much value we think they'll add to the game, not based off whose turn it is. In each case the value's seemed higher from working on Ryze than Fiddle. Some of that Ryze work's been good for him overall (e.g. making him into a mana scaling mage originally helped to differentiate him a lot). Some of it hasn't been great overall (the last rework solved some issues and introduced others).
